result.execSummary:
The defendant Caprice J Ware was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Caprice J Ware

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:40am-  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty; found guilty by the court.  Court orders a fine plus costs totaling $150.00.  Bond on deposit to be applied.  Appeal rights given.

State advises the court that the DE appeared at the DA pre-trial w/ Attorney Edwards & discussed a possible resolution but she was not an appointed attorney.  Court adjourns matter to June 23, 2015 at 08:45 am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
